intro: Cliffortia acerosa, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is a perennial shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Cliffortia acerosa is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appearance and ecological role.
